items.text: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
items.plainText: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

items.text: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?
items.plainText: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?

items.text: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
items.plainText: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.

items.text: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.
items.plainText: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.

items.text: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?
items.plainText: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?

items.text: Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;
items.plainText: Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;

items.text: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
items.plainText: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

items.text: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?
items.plainText: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?

items.text: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,
items.plainText: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,

items.text: And brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,
items.plainText: And brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,

items.text: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
items.plainText: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?

items.text: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;
items.plainText: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;

items.text: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
items.plainText: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?

items.text: It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.
items.plainText: It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.

items.text: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.
items.plainText: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.

items.text: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?
items.plainText: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?

items.text: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?
items.plainText: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?

items.text: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.
items.plainText: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.

items.text: Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
items.plainText: Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,

items.text: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?
items.plainText: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?

items.text: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?
items.plainText: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?

items.text: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
items.plainText: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,

items.text: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
items.plainText: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

items.text: By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?
items.plainText: By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?

items.text: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;
items.plainText: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;

items.text: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;
items.plainText: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;

items.text: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?
items.plainText: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?

items.text: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
items.plainText: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?

items.text: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
items.plainText: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?

items.text: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
items.plainText: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.

items.text: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
items.plainText: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?

items.text: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?
items.plainText: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?

items.text: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?
items.plainText: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?

items.text: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
items.plainText: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?

items.text: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?
items.plainText: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?

items.text: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?
items.plainText: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?

items.text: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,
items.plainText: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,

items.text: When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?
items.plainText: When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?

items.text: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,
items.plainText: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,

items.text: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?
items.plainText: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?

items.text: Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
items.plainText: Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
